label: Description
value: Large leaves and globular bud forms. Brocaded threads silver and gold metallic, blue, yellow, lavender, pink, peach and green on ivory satin damask. Style is known as 'bizarre'.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metal Technique: brocaded damask

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

Design for a Pedestal and a Bowl, Intended for Execution in White and Rose Marbles for Marie Antoinette at St. Cloud

label: Description
value: The pedestal stands upon a base. It is supported at the corners by obliquely disposed griffins. A relief at its front shows two girls pouring water from a jar into an urn. Dolphin masks support festoons above. The bowl has a foot. One side of it is pointed, a mermaid is shown at the opposite one holding snakes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and grey and rose watercolor, black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt

label: Description
value: A frieze consisting of rinceaux motifs with three spirals connected by a bead festoon and a peahen eye. Reverse: Satyrs in landscape. Three Satyrs blow musical instruments, two Satyr children play tambourines. A Satyr carries a dead lamb to an altar, at left. A Satyress mixes a drink in the center. A terminus stands at right of her. Framing mouldings on top, at bottom are shown in the left part.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray watercolor, Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: An ovoidal medallion with cupid riding a dolphin is flanked by rinceaux. Verso: an ovoidal frieze is bordered by bands with laural garlands on top and bottom edge. The landscape consists of trees, plants, a house, a bridge, a gate, a poplar alley. Some men are shown, three of them near monumental Hermae. Bottom left: a part of a leaf border.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray watercolor, Chiese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Design for a Standing Frame, Probably for a Screen

label: Description
value: Moulded frame upon two feet shaped like entablatures of a pediment. Birds seated at the top corners support a garland hanging in festoons. The entire width is indicated as 28 po". An ovoid is sketched inside.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and wash, Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
